Issues.Title: fix(animations): leaking detached nodes when parent has a leave transition
Issues.Body:
In the `TransitionAnimationEngine` we keep track of the existing elements with animations and we clear the cached data when they're removed. We also have some logic where we transition away the child elements when a parent is removed, however in that case we never cleared the cached element data which resulted in a memory leak. The leak is particularly visible in Material where whenever there's an animated overlay with a component inside of it that has an animation, the child component would always be retained in memory.

Fixes #25744.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(animations): leaking detached nodes when parent has a leave transition" (#34409)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): validate the NgModule declarations field
Issues.Body:
This commit adds three previously missing validations to
NgModule.declarations:

1. It checks that declared classes are actually within the current
   compilation.

2. It checks that declared classes are directives, components, or pipes.

3. It checks that classes are declared in at most one NgModule.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): validate the NgModule declarations field" (#34404)

Issues.Title: Ivy: Remove entryComponents property from @NgModule decorator in @angular/core migrations
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/core

The relevant migrations are currently located at:
https://github.com/angular/angular/tree/master/packages/core/schematics/migrations

### Description
Updating to Angular version 9 performs several post-install migrations using schematics. These are incredible, and very much appreciated. ‚ù§Ô∏è

This feature request is to add an additional migration when updating to Angular v9 using the `ng update` command to remove the `entryComponents` property in all `@NgModule()` decorators since the code is unnecessary after updating to Angular version 9 with Ivy.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Remove `entryComponents` property in `@NgModule()` decorators using schematics.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Alternative include:

1. Manually remove `entryComponents` after updating.
2. Leave the `entryComponents` after updating since it does not cause an errors or side effects.
3. Create a schematic separate from the @angular/core module to perform the migration for those that desire this functionality.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy: Remove entryComponents property from @NgModule decorator in @angular/core migrations" (#34399)

Issues.Title: Service Worker - Feedback if SwUpdate.checkForUpdate does not find an update
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
This feature request is for @angular/service-worker

### Description
It would be nice if calling SwUpdate.checkForUpdate() had some kind of feedback from the function if there isn't an update available.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Ideally checkForUpdate would return a Promise boolean rather than Promise void, where the boolean is true if there is an update and false if there is no update.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I have not thought of any alternatives.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Service Worker - Feedback if SwUpdate.checkForUpdate does not find an update" (#34397)

Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->

# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

In the times of Angular v2, there was a semi-official [statement](https://www.bennadel.com/blog/3038-eventemitter-is-an-rxjs-observable-stream-in-angular-2-beta-6.htm#comments_47949) not to use rxjs `Observable` or `Subject` directly instead of `EventEmitter` because the implementation of `EventEmitter` might change in the future.

I am wondering if this is still valid today, given that rxjs is a first-class citizen of Angular and any serious project based on Angular?

I found myself always wishing to use observable or piped observable directly in my reactive component instead of going out of my way to call `EventEmitter.emit`.

If the statement is still valid, could it perhaps be valuable to be documented?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "rxjs Observable or Subject instead EventEmitter" (#34394)

Issues.Body:
local-part email address can contain dot( . )  character inside qouetes( ' )
but currently only one dot( . )  character is alowed,
whereas email address can contain multiple dot( . ) operators inside qoutes ( ' )
Ref: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Email_address

Issues.Title: Not reset the template parser's error when using JIT compiler
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package `@angular/compiler` ### Is this a regression? No sure, But got the same problem on `v9-rc.4` and `v8.2` ### Description #### Background I am using Angular to rewrite the front end of [apache/zeppelin](https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/tree/web_angular), it allows users to enter dynamic templates and run, so I trying to implement this feature using the JIT compiler but blocked by this problem. #### Steps to reproduce Open the live DEMO https://ng-jit-template-parse-errors.now.sh/ and browser's console. Enter the following code in the textarea. ```html ``` Click the render button and we will see the following errors in the console, this is good because this error is expected. ``` vendor-es2015.js:40954 ERROR Error: Template parse errors: Parser Error: Unexpected end of expression: i = i++ at the end of the expression [i = i++] in ng:////template.html@0:17 (""): ng:////template.html@0:17 ``` Then enter the correct template into the textarea and click the render button again. ```html ``` Expect no error, but still got the same error. ``` vendor-es2015.js:40954 ERROR Error: Template parse errors: Parser Error: Unexpected end of expression: i = i++ at the end of the expression [i = i++] in ng:////template.html@0:17 (""): ng:////template.html@0:17 ``` I guess the error was cached, so I called the method `compiler.clearCache()`, but it still didn't work. I tried using the `…µrenderComponent` method to render the dynamic component, the error is disappeared, but I can not use other modules (like `FormsModule`) feature in this component. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/github/hsuanxyz/ng-jit-template-parse-errors Repo: https://github.com/hsuanxyz/ng-jit-template-parse-errors/ ## üî• Exception or Error ``` vendor-es2015.js:40954 ERROR Error: Template parse errors: Parser Error: Unexpected end of expression: i = i++ at the end of the expression [i = i++] in ng:////template.html@2:17 (" {{name}}
"): ng:////template.html@2:17 Parser Error: Unexpected end of expression: i = i++ at the end of the expression [i = i++] in ng:////template.html@2:17 (" {{name}}
"): ng:////template.html@2:26 at syntaxError (vendor-es2015.js:10006) at htmlAstToRender3Ast (vendor-es2015.js:22123) at parseTemplate (vendor-es2015.js:24817) at CompilerFacadeImpl.compileComponent (vendor-es2015.js:25661) at Function.get (vendor-es2015.js:70705) at getComponentDef (vendor-es2015.js:37333) at assertComponentType (vendor-es2015.js:37743) at ComponentFactoryResolver$1.resolveComponentFactory (vendor-es2015.js:65766) at AppComponent.renderDynamicComponent (main-es2015.js:66) at AppComponent_Template_button_click_2_listener (main-es2015.js:83) ``` ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** ```bash Angular CLI: 9.0.0-rc.6 Node: 12.11.1 OS: darwin x64 Angular: 9.0.0-rc.6 ... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic ... router Ivy Workspace: Yes Package Version ----------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.900.0-rc.6 @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.900.0-rc.6 @angular-devkit/build-optimizer 0.900.0-rc.6 @angular-devkit/build-webpack 0.900.0-rc.6 @angular-devkit/core 9.0.0-rc.6 @angular-devkit/schematics 9.0.0-rc.6 @ngtools/webpack 9.0.0-rc.6 @schematics/angular 9.0.0-rc.6 @schematics/update 0.900.0-rc.6 rxjs 6.5.3 typescript 3.6.4 webpack 4.41.2 ``` **Anything else relevant?**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Not reset the template parser's error when using JIT compiler" (#34387)

Issues.Title: valueChanges emits even when the value hasn't changed
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/403bb6bee341ac12c9bfbd9f910432c2d385886f/packages/forms/src/model.ts#L295-L300 is a lie. In particular, it says valueChanges "emits an event every time the value of the control changes", but in fact when you call `enable()` or `disable()` without passing along `{emitEvent: false}` it will also emit :(

This behavior should either be removed or documented (even if it's documented as being recommended against).

**Affected documentation page:** https://angular.io/api/forms/AbstractControl
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "valueChanges emits even when the value hasn't changed" (#34407)

Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [x] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? nope, this is related to angular 9 migration ### Description When upgrading a **library** to angular 9, ie `ng update @angular/cli @angular/core --next`, `angular.json` is updated to reference `tsconfig.lib.prod.json`. The path is wrong, as it's missing a leading dot (`.`) ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - clone https://github.com/mpalourdio/ng-http-loader - run `ng update @angular/cli @angular/core --next` - yarn build --prod ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, it worked fine in RC.4 ### Description I recently updated my project from CLI 9.0.0-rc.4 to 9.0.0-rc.6. After upgrading, my file replacements of environment files are no longer working. I use a json file in the assets folder to store my environment variables, which is populated at build with different values depending on my build configuration. Now, instead of filling the file in with the values from the replacement file, nothing happens and the original json file from the assets/ folder is built. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Clone the repo: https://github.com/markheron91/TestAngularCLIRC6FileReplacements.git 
ng build --configuration=local

Issues.Title: @v8.3.x - auditted cross site scripting vulnerability in `serialize-javascript`
Issues.Body:
Hi Guys

I hope I'm targetting the right branch for `"@angular-devkit/build-angular": "^0.803.20"`. There is a `yarn audit` reported vulnerability via `terser-webpack-plugin@4.1.1` and `copy-webpack-plugin@5.0.4`.

```bash
$ yarn audit
yarn audit v1.19.2
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ moderate      ‚îÇ Cross-Site Scripting                                         ‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ Package       ‚îÇ serialize-javascript                                         ‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ Patched in    ‚îÇ >=2.1.1                                                      ‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ Dependency of ‚îÇ @angular-devkit/build-angular                                ‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§

Issues.Title: fix(sidenav): unable to close by pressing escape in side mode
Issues.Body:
We currently listen for `keydown` events on the sidenav so that we know when to close it, however in `side` mode we don't trap focus inside the sidenav which means that unless the user goes into the sidenav manually, the escape listener won't work. These changes fix the issue by listening to keyboard events at the `document` level.

Fixes #17965.

Issues.Title: feat(material/*): First pass implementation of focus indicators.
Issues.Body:
**Demo:** http://100.88.8.105:4200

**Implementation summary:**

* Focus indicators were added to all components other than chips.
  * Focus indicators only added to elements that had associated click handlers. For example: `mat-selection-list` and `mat-dialog` are focusable, but not expected to ever have click handlers. If we want focus indicators for these elements, we can add them in a follow-up PR.
  * Chips will be in a follow-up PR. Focus indicator for chips likely requires an additional element.
* The class `.mat-focus-indicator` was added to the appropriate elements within each component. Components with multiple focusable elements had `.mat-focus-indicator` added to multiple elements.
  * For almost all components (besides the ones below), the class `.mat-focus-indicator` is added to the element that has focus (the actual `document.activeElement`).  Focus indicator is rendered when element has focus.
  * For checkbox, radio, and slide toggle, the class `.mat-focus-indicator` is added to the associated `mat-ripple`. This is because the actual focused input is visually hidden and consequently does not have a bounding box to render the focus indicator on. Focus indicator is rendered when the class `.cdk-focused` is present on the parent checkbox/radio/slide toggle.
  * For option, each `.mat-option` does not actually take focus as a user arrows through the options. Focus indicator is rendered when the option is active (i.e. when the class `.mat-active` is present).
* The focus indicator itself is rendered on `.mat-focus-indicator::before`. The before pseudo-element is positioned absolutely. The `.mat-focus-indicator` element is positioned relatively.
* For most components, the focus indicator has no inset/offset. For some components, the focus indicator does have inset/offset. This decision was made on a per-component basis. All components support inset focus indicators, not all components support offset focus indicators. FWIW, I believe that any component that *needs* to support offset focus indicators *does* support offset focus indicators.
* All focus indicator CSS is decoupled from core CSS. Users must manually pull in `mat-focus-indicator` and `mat-focus-indicator-theme` mixins.
* Focus indicator is always the primary color. Some mechanism to invert the color will be added in a follow-up PR.

**Some notes:**

* What's nice about using the actual focused element as the host for the focus indicator (i.e. the host for the pseudo-element) is that SRs will also draw their focus indicators on this element. It's important that the actual focused element has an appropriate bounding box, and this feature helps to enforce that. I think this is really nice.
* No new elements were added!
* `position: relative` was added to 3 components. If this is a problem, make note. These changes can also potentially live within the focus indicator mixin.
* Focus indicator appears on mouse click, which is weird. It shows up a little more frequently when using a mouse than I'd like. This is something we'll have to address in a future PR.
* Have not tested on high contrast yet.

I'll squash/rename my commits before merging to follow naming conventions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(material/*): First pass implementation of focus indicators." (#17966)

Issues.Title: Closing sidenav with escape does not work when mode is "side"
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Open this [stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/sidenav-autofocus-bug) 
2. Click the sidenav.toggle() button to open sidenav
3. Press escape on your keyboard
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
I was expecting the sidenav to close. 

#### Actual Behavior

Sidenav does not close.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2
- CDK/Material: 8.2
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS

#### Workaround

There seems to be 2 workarounds. [Related SO question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/59328308/how-to-close-angular-material-sidenav-with-escape).

1. Setting focus inside the sidenav, and then pressing escape
2. Adding a `@HostListener` on the esc key
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Closing sidenav with escape does not work when mode is "side" " (#17965)

Issues.Title: Outlined Mat-Form-Field label alignment issue when using matPrefix inside a dialog.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-jglvgg

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click on the different inputs so that the label transitions.
2. The input Labeled "Broken Input" shows the issue while the other inputs are just for reference.
 
#### Expected Behavior

The label should not overlap and take into account matPrefix spacing in dialogs.

#### Actual Behavior

If you focus the different inputs you will notice that the field labeled Broken Input will overlap the outline border and have extra spacing before the label. 

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.14
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows

#### Notes

I noticed that there are several other issues relating to Label alignment on Outlined fields but I found those issues either lacking in substance or not relating to inputs in Dialogs.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Outlined Mat-Form-Field label alignment issue when using matPrefix inside a dialog." (#17963)

Issues.Title: Dialog focus restoration doesn't work on mat-menu-items
Issues.Body:
If you trigger a dialog from a `mat-menu-item`'s click handler, the focused item is the mat-menu-item itself. This gets saved in `_elementFocusedBeforeDialogWasOpened`. But that element is gone from the DOM when the dialog is closed, so focus is restored to the body.

It would be cool if the dialog could somehow keep track of the fact that it was a transient menu item that was focused, and focus ought to go back to the menu's trigger instead.

Waiting a tick before opening the dialog fixes it, because the menu itself focuses the trigger before the dialog opens, so it gets the right element ref.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dialog focus restoration doesn't work on mat-menu-items" (#17962)

Issues.Title: MatSelect inconsistent with Material Guideline / degraded readability
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

1. Use a standard [Material Select](https://stackblitz.com/angular/rodxqedrknx?file=src%2Fapp%2Fselect-overview-example.ts).
2. Select an option.
3. Open the select menu again.

 
#### Expected Behavior

Issues.Title: mat-menu missing API to set aria-label
Issues.Body:
`<mat-menu>` doesn't have an API that lets the user set an `aria-label` on the `role="menu"` element. 

I'd like to fix this long term by moving to a different menu API, something like
```html
<mat-menu *matMenuDef>
  ...
</mat-menu>
```
(where `mat-menu` is the `role="menu"` element)

In the interim, we should just add an input for this.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-menu missing API to set aria-label" (#17952)

Issues.Title: Exiting Menu Component via screen-reader for iOS jumps user to top/bottom of page
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Issue is easily reproducible in the Angular Material documentation using iOS VoiceOver: https://material.angular.io/components/menu/overview

Steps to reproduce:
1. Navigate to https://material.angular.io/components/menu/overview using an iOS device with the VoiceOver native screen reader enabled.
2. Swipe-navigate to the component example for the Menu (see screenshot at end of section).
3. Double-tap to activate and open menu - focus will move to first item of the menu (on occasion, the menu immediately closes instead).
4a. Swipe back once to navigate back out of the menu - observe that focus is moved to the bottom of the DOM.
4b. OR swipe forward twice to navigate past the last menu item to move past menu to next part of the document - observe that focus is instead directed to the top of the DOM.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1666565/70722343-1b471600-1cc5-11ea-805c-8391b4ffddab.png) 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
1. Swipe-navigating back out of the menu should allow a user to either navigate back to the menu button they activated, or focus should select the menu element, which can close on double tap as the menu functions using Android TalkBack.
2. Swipe-navigating past the last item of the menu should move the user's focus to the next element in the DOM past the original menu item.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
When opening the Menu Component using iOS VoiceOver, the only means of navigating away from the menu are:
1. Navigate to the top of the DOM
2. Navigate to the bottom of the DOM
3. Tap off the menu to select another part of the document (users who depend on screen readers would lose place in document)

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.14 (assuming this is what is used on the Angular Material documentation)
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome 79.0.3945.73 for iOS, Safari 13 for iOS
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): iOS 13.3

#### Technical Notes
This is due to the menu being generated dynamically at the bottom of the DOM, instead of placement relative to the host element. This interrupts normal tab flow throughout the document, which would create confusion for users.

Possible solutions would be to implement the same functionality seen using Android TalkBack (menu element as a whole is selectable when swiping back, and closable on double-tap), or to relocate the menu's generation to be relative to the host menu button.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Exiting Menu Component via screen-reader for iOS jumps user to top/bottom of page" (#17951)

Issues.Title: Tooltip not working when disable zone listeners
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-rsexfj-qmyu2j

Steps to reproduce:

Add to polyfills.ts

```ts
(window as any)['__Zone_ignore_on_properties'] = [];

const targets: any[] = [window, Document.prototype, HTMLBodyElement.prototype, HTMLElement.prototype];
const ignoreEvents: string[] = [
    'scroll',
    'mouseenter',
    'mouseleave',
    'mousemove',
    'mouseover',
    'mouseout',
    'mousewheel',
    'mousemove',
    'resize'
];

targets.forEach((target: any) => {
    (window as any)['__Zone_ignore_on_properties'].push({ target, ignoreProperties: ignoreEvents });
});

(window as any)['__Zone_enable_cross_context_check'] = true; // disable patch requestAnimationFrame
(window as any)['__Zone_disable_requestAnimationFrame'] = true; // disable patch requestAnimationFrame
(window as any)['__Zone_disable_on_property'] = true; // disable patch onProperty such as onclick
(window as any)['__zone_symbol__BLACK_LISTED_EVENTS'] = ignoreEvents; // disable patch specified eventNames
(window as any)['__zone_symbol__UNPATCHED_EVENTS'] = ignoreEvents; // disable patch specified eventNames
```
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12021443/70724510-cd093580-1d0b-11ea-98da-95eb8d56dfd1.png)

#### Expected Behavior

This should not depend on turning off the zones.

#### Environment

- Angular: last
- CDK/Material: last
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  any
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tooltip not working when disable zone listeners" (#17950)

Issues.Title: fix(dialog): DOM nodes not cleaned up if view container is destroyed before close animation starts
Issues.Body:
Currently the dialog's cleanup logic is tied to its exit animation completing and the close animation starting. This usually isn't a problem since by default the dialog is attached to the application ref, however if the consumer has set a viewContainerRef and that ref is destroyed before animation even starts, the exit animation event will never fire. These changes add a timeout as a fallback in case the animation doesn't start.

Fixes #17891.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(dialog): DOM nodes not cleaned up if view container is destroyed before close animation starts" (#17947)

Issues.Title: Does mat-tree support MatNestedTreeNode.level property?
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-dew9or

Steps to reproduce:
1. Just look at console log after it (tree) loads. Contents of the tree are not a subject of the issue - only the console error.

`ERROR TypeError: "_co.treeControl.getLevel is not a function"`
 
#### Expected Behavior

API notes presence of level property - for both flat and nested nodes.
https://material.angular.io/components/tree/api#MatNestedTreeNode
`treeControl.getLevel(dataNode)` should be able to retrieve it, right?

#### Actual Behavior

Using:
```
{{treeControl.getLevel(dataNode)}}
```
...is apparently broken? Or not documented well.
I've also tried accessing "level" property through:
```
@ViewChildren(MatNestedTreeNode)
nestedNodes: QueryList<MatNestedTreeNode<Privilege>>;
```
...but it always returns 0, no matter when or what node You ask.

It seems like level property is never set, nor supported by treeControl.

Should or will level property be supported in nested nodes?

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.14
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Any/All (tested on Firefox)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Any/All
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Does mat-tree support MatNestedTreeNode.level property?" (#17945)

Issues.Title: Option to disable focus on bottom sheets
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Currently if `autoFocus` is disabled the focus is still being set to the container:

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/45d34ad4ff85d36096df5ccef1b1f5658364372d/src/material/bottom-sheet/bottom-sheet-container.ts#L206-L215

It would be really useful to disable focus capturing entirely.

#### Use Case

In my case the bottom sheet is triggered by changing the value of a text input - which results in losing focus as soon as the bottom sheet opens.

As a workaround I'm saving the previously selected element and reset the focus to this element within `afterOpened`. The disadvantage of this workaround is that if you're switching focus before the bottom sheet is completely opened (e.g. by hitting tab) the focus is reset to the wrong element.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Option to disable focus on bottom sheets" (#17944)
